nodeDefinition.details: If Originator Type of incoming message is expected - send Message via True chain, otherwise False chain is used.
nodeDefinition.description: Filter incoming messages by message Originator Type

nodeDefinition.details: Routes messages to chain according to the originator type ('Device', 'Asset', etc.).
nodeDefinition.description: Route incoming messages by Message Originator Type

nodeDefinition.details:
Evaluate incoming Message with configured JS condition. If True - send Message via True chain, otherwise False chain is used.Message payload can be accessed via msg property. For example msg.temperature < 10;
Message metadata can be accessed via metadata property. For example metadata.customerName === 'John';
Message type can be accessed via msgType property.
nodeDefinition.description: Filter incoming messages using JS script

nodeDefinition.details:
Node executes configured JS script. Script should return array of next Chain names where Message should be routed. If Array is empty - message not routed to next Node. Message payload can be accessed via msg property. For example msg.temperature < 10;
Message metadata can be accessed via metadata property. For example metadata.customerName === 'John';
Message type can be accessed via msgType property.
nodeDefinition.description: Route incoming Message to one or multiple output chains

nodeDefinition.details: If incoming MessageType is expected - send Message via True chain, otherwise False chain is used.
nodeDefinition.description: Filter incoming messages by Message Type

nodeDefinition.details: If at least one relation exists - send Message via True chain, otherwise False chain is used.
nodeDefinition.description: Checks the relation from the selected entity to the originator of the message by type and direction if 'Check for single entity' is set to true, otherwise rule node will check if exist any relation to the originator of the message by type and direction.

nodeDefinition.details: Sends messages with message types "Post attributes", "Post telemetry", "RPC Request" etc. via corresponding chain, otherwise Other chain is used.
nodeDefinition.description: Route incoming messages by Message Type

nodeDefinition.details: If selected checkbox 'Check that all selected keys are present'" and all keys in message data and metadata are exist - send Message via True chain, otherwise False chain is used. Else if the checkbox is not selected, and at least one of the keys from data or metadata of the message exists - send Message via True chain, otherwise, False chain is used.
nodeDefinition.description: Checks the existence of the selected keys from message data and metadata.

nodeDefinition.details: Generates messages with configurable period. Javascript function used for message generation.
nodeDefinition.description: Periodically generates messages

nodeDefinition.details: Expects messages with any message type. Will forward message body to the device.
nodeDefinition.description: Sends reply to RPC call from device

nodeDefinition.details: Details - JS function that creates JSON object based on incoming message. This object will be added into Alarm.details field. Node output: If alarm was not created, original message is returned. Otherwise new Message returned with type 'ALARM', Alarm object in 'msg' property and 'matadata' will contains one of those properties 'isNewAlarm/isExistingAlarm'. Message payload can be accessed via msg property. For example 'temperature = ' + msg.temperature ;. Message metadata can be accessed via metadata property. For example 'name = ' + metadata.customerName;.
nodeDefinition.description: Create or Update Alarm

nodeDefinition.details: Delays messages for configurable period.
nodeDefinition.description: Delays incoming message

nodeDefinition.details: Count incoming messages for specified interval and produces POST_TELEMETRY_REQUEST msg with messages count
nodeDefinition.description: Count incoming messages

nodeDefinition.details: If the relation(s) successfully deleted - Message send via Success chain, otherwise Failure chain will be used.
nodeDefinition.description: Finds target Entity by entity name pattern and then delete a relation to Originator Entity by type and direction if 'Delete single entity' is set to true, otherwise rule node will delete all relations to the originator of the message by type and direction.

nodeDefinition.details: Saves timeseries telemetry data based on configurable TTL parameter. Expects messages with 'POST_TELEMETRY_REQUEST' message type
nodeDefinition.description: Saves timeseries data

nodeDefinition.details:
This node should be used together with "synchronization end" node. 
 This node will put messages into queue based on message originator id. 
Subsequent messages will not be processed until the previous message processing is completed or timeout event occurs.
Size of the queue per originator and timeout values are configurable on a system level
nodeDefinition.description: Starts synchronization of message processing based on message originator

nodeDefinition.details:
Copy attributes from asset/device to related entity view according to entity view configuration. 
 Copy will be done only for attributes that are between start and end dates and according to attribute keys configuration. 
Changes message originator to related entity view and produces new messages according to count of updated entity views
nodeDefinition.description: Copy attributes from asset/device to entity view and changes message originator to related entity view

nodeDefinition.details: If the relation already exists or successfully created - Message send via Success chain, otherwise Failure chain will be used.
nodeDefinition.description:
Finds target Entity by entity name pattern and (entity type pattern for Asset, Device) and then create a relation to Originator Entity by type and direction. If Selected entity type: Asset, Device or Customer will create new Entity if it doesn't exist and selected checkbox 'Create new entity if not exists'.
In case that relation from the message originator to the selected entity not exist and If selected checkbox 'Remove current relations', before creating the new relation all existed relations to message originator by type and direction will be removed.
If relation from the message originator to the selected entity created and If selected checkbox 'Change originator to related entity', outbound message will be processed as a message from this entity.

nodeDefinition.details: Saves entity attributes based on configurable scope parameter. Expects messages with 'POST_ATTRIBUTES_REQUEST' message type
nodeDefinition.description: Saves attributes data
Stops synchronization of message processing based on message originator

nodeDefinition.details: Transform incoming Message with configured JS function to String and log final value into Thingsboard log file. Message payload can be accessed via msg property. For example 'temperature = ' + msg.temperature ;. Message metadata can be accessed via metadata property. For example 'name = ' + metadata.customerName;.
nodeDefinition.description: Log incoming messages using JS script for transformation Message into String

nodeDefinition.details: Finds target Entity Customer by Customer name pattern and then unassign Originator Entity from this customer.
nodeDefinition.description: Unassign Message Originator Entity from Customer

nodeDefinition.details: Details - JS function that creates JSON object based on incoming message. This object will be added into Alarm.details field. Node output: If alarm was not cleared, original message is returned. Otherwise new Message returned with type 'ALARM', Alarm object in 'msg' property and 'matadata' will contains 'isClearedAlarm' property. Message payload can be accessed via msg property. For example 'temperature = ' + msg.temperature ;. Message metadata can be accessed via metadata property. For example 'name = ' + metadata.customerName;.
nodeDefinition.description: Clear Alarm

nodeDefinition.details: Expects messages with "method" and "params". Will forward response from device to next nodes.If the RPC call request is originated by REST API call from user, will forward the response to user immediately.
nodeDefinition.description: Sends RPC call to device

nodeDefinition.details: Finds target Customer by customer name pattern and then assign Originator Entity to this customer. Will create new Customer if it doesn't exists and 'Create new Customer if not exists' is set to true.
nodeDefinition.description: Assign Message Originator Entity to Customer

nodeDefinition.details: The node allows you to select fetch mode FIRST/LAST/ALL to fetch telemetry of certain time range that are added into Message metadata without any prefix. If selected fetch mode ALL Telemetry will be added like array into Message Metadata where key is Timestamp and value is value of Telemetry. Note: The maximum size of the fetched array is 1000 records. If selected fetch mode FIRST or LAST Telemetry will be added like string without Timestamp
nodeDefinition.description: Add Message Originator Telemetry for selected time range into Message Metadata

nodeDefinition.details: If Attributes enrichment configured, server scope attributes are added into Message metadata. If Latest Telemetry enrichment configured, latest telemetry added into metadata. To access those attributes in other nodes this template can be used metadata.temperature.
nodeDefinition.description: Add Originators Tenant Attributes or Latest Telemetry into Message Metadata

nodeDefinition.details: If Attributes enrichment configured, CLIENT/SHARED/SERVER attributes are added into Message metadata with specific prefix: cs/shared/ss. Latest telemetry value added into metadata without prefix. To access those attributes in other nodes this template can be used metadata.cs_temperature or metadata.shared_limit
nodeDefinition.description: Add Message Originator Attributes or Latest Telemetry into Message Metadata

nodeDefinition.details: Will fetch fields values specified in mapping. If specified field is not part of originator fields it will be ignored.
nodeDefinition.description: Add Message Originator fields values into Message Metadata

nodeDefinition.details: Related Entity found using configured relation direction and Relation Type. If multiple Related Entities are found, only first Entity is used for attributes enrichment, other entities are discarded. If Attributes enrichment configured, server scope attributes are added into Message metadata. If Latest Telemetry enrichment configured, latest telemetry added into metadata. To access those attributes in other nodes this template can be used metadata.temperature.
nodeDefinition.description: Add Originators Related Entity Attributes or Latest Telemetry into Message Metadata

nodeDefinition.details: If Attributes enrichment configured, CLIENT/SHARED/SERVER attributes are added into Message metadata with specific prefix: cs/shared/ss. Latest telemetry value added into metadata without prefix. To access those attributes in other nodes this template can be used metadata.cs_temperature or metadata.shared_limit
nodeDefinition.description: Add Originators Related Device Attributes and Latest Telemetry value into Message Metadata

nodeDefinition.details: If Attributes enrichment configured, server scope attributes are added into Message metadata. If Latest Telemetry enrichment configured, latest telemetry added into metadata. To access those attributes in other nodes this template can be used metadata.temperature.
nodeDefinition.description: Add Originators Customer Attributes or Latest Telemetry into Message Metadata

nodeDefinition.details: Related Entity found using configured relation direction and Relation Type. If multiple Related Entities are found, only first Entity is used as new Originator, other entities are discarded.
nodeDefinition.description: Change Message Originator To Tenant/Customer/Related Entity

nodeDefinition.details:
JavaScript function receive 3 input parameters
metadata - is a Message metadata.
msg - is a Message payload.
msgType - is a Message type.
Should return the following structure:
{ msg: new payload,
   metadata: new metadata,
   msgType: new msgType }
All fields in resulting object are optional and will be taken from original message if not specified.
nodeDefinition.description: Change Message payload, Metadata or Message type using JavaScript

defaultConfiguration.jsScript: return {msg: msg, metadata: metadata, msgType: msgType};

nodeDefinition.details: Transforms message to email message by populating email fields using values derived from message metadata. Set 'SEND_EMAIL' output message type.
nodeDefinition.description: Transforms message to email message

nodeDefinition.details: Will publish message payload to RabbitMQ queue.
nodeDefinition.description: Publish messages to the RabbitMQ

nodeDefinition.details: Will invoke REST API call GET | POST | PUT | DELETE to external REST server. Message payload added into Request body. Configured attributes can be added into Headers from Message Metadata. Outbound message will contain response fields (status, statusCode, statusReason and response headers) in the Message Metadata. Response body saved in outbound Message payload. For example statusCode field can be accessed with metadata.statusCode.
nodeDefinition.description: Invoke REST API calls to external REST server

nodeDefinition.details: Will publish message payload to the MQTT broker with QoS AT_LEAST_ONCE.
nodeDefinition.description: Publish messages to the MQTT broker

nodeDefinition.details: Will send record via Kafka producer to Kafka server. Outbound message will contain response fields (offset, partition, topic) from the Kafka in the Message Metadata. For example partition field can be accessed with metadata.partition.
nodeDefinition.description: Publish messages to Kafka server

nodeDefinition.details: Will publish message payload and metadata attributes to the AWS SQS queue. Outbound message will contain response fields (messageId, requestId, messageBodyMd5, messageAttributesMd5, sequenceNumber) in the Message Metadata from the AWS SQS. For example requestId field can be accessed with metadata.requestId.
nodeDefinition.description: Publish messages to the AWS SQS

nodeDefinition.details: Will publish message payload to the AWS SNS topic. Outbound message will contain response fields (messageId, requestId) in the Message Metadata from the AWS SNS. For example requestId field can be accessed with metadata.requestId.
nodeDefinition.description: Publish message to the AWS SNS

nodeDefinition.details: Expects messages with SEND_EMAIL type. Node works only with messages that where created using to Email transformation Node, please connect this Node with to Email Node using Successful chain.
nodeDefinition.description: Sends email message via SMTP server.
